overview:
StudioTweets turns Twitter into your personal music Critic.

Whether itâ€™s Vinyl, Tapes, CDâ€™s, MP3â€™s or whatever the future may hold, sharing your own musical tastes and finding out what your friends and favourite celebritiesâ€™ views on music has always been at the forefront.

With the advent of social services such as Twitter this has become increasingly frequent and thereâ€™s a good chance that most of your friends and most probably many other people around the globe, are tweeting about a new song or artist every minute. Tracking so many tweets and opinions has become almost impossible due to the sheer volume and nature of tweets that individuals mention. This causes a problem as this means that people are going to overlook really interesting tweets (sometimes even from the artists themselves!).

StudioTweets.com aims to fix this problem by using its own Sentiment Engine to turn Twitter into a fully fledged music critic.

StudioTweets allows people to view music orientated tweets based upon who they are following as well as the twitter community as a whole. StudioTweets also lets Users rate an individualâ€™s taste in music. Furthermore, StudioTweets harnesses Twitter to facilitate reviews and ratings on musical content.

Users only need their existing Twitter login information to sign up. Each Userâ€™s profile allows them to view what their friends are saying about music. The site will also have profiles for Albums and individual songs, containing a Rating, Positive and Negative Tweets (categorised by our sentiment engine), Tweets by friends and much more. Users will also have the option to purchase an album or individual songs.

Sharing musical interests is also a key aspect of the site, which is why StudioTweets allows users to publish a link to their StudioTweets profile either on somebody elses Twitter Profile or as a status update on their own profile.
